title.narrative: INCLUSIVE EDUCATION

description.narrative: Strengthened early warning systems at central and municipal levels (including schools) to prevent, respond, and to monitor dropout cases, particularly among the most excluded children from all communities including Kosovo Serbs, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, more children with disabilities as well as from Roma, Ashkali and Egyptian communities, as well as Kosovo-Albanians and Kosovo Serbs have access to and utilize a quality continuum of health care and quality education services

title.narrative: Strengthened early warning systems at central and municipal levels (including schools) to prevent, respond, and to monitor dropoutcases, particularly among the most excluded children from all communities including Kosovo Serbs

description.narrative: As a response to COVID-19 situation, UNICEF Kosovo supported Ministry of Education and Science (MES) to develop Guidelines for continuation of education and reopening of schools. Through UNICEF support to MES and National Institute of Public Health, the Case Registry and Reporting module was developed within EMIS to track and monitor the numbers of COVID-19 infections of students and school staff. The capacities of education officials at central and municipal levels, including teachers across 30 Kosovo municipalities have been developed to apply the new Case Registry and Reporting System module on a daily basis. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
